intro: Byrsocarpus boivinianus, commonly known as the Bornean starfruit, is a tropical plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It is a small shrub that produces distinctive yellow-orange fruits with a star-shaped appearance. The plant belongs to the family Oxalidaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. Its fruit is edible, though it is less commonly consumed compared to other starfruit varieties. The plant plays a role in local ecosystems and has been the subject of botanical studies due to its unique morphology and habitat.
